database.availableLicenses.description: In 2024 a new law increased access to liquor licenses in several parts of Boston. Through this law the city will be issuing 5 new on premise liquor licenses to 13 of Boston’s Zip Codes each year for the next 3 years.
database.availableLicenses.title: 2024 Cohort Licenses
database.header.description: Browse through available licenses in each of Boston's ZIP codes, view important information regarding each license type and recent license applications. As well as important dates for license applications.
database.header.nextMeeting: The next Licensing Boarding meeting is: {nextMeetingDate, date, long}
database.header.title: License Database
database.licenseTerminology.description: Boston has several different types of licenses all coming from a variety of different needs, laws, and statues. This can be confusing when navigating through the licensing process for the first time. Below are some basic licensing terms along with their definitions to help navigate the Boston liquor license system.
database.licenseTerminology.allAlcohol.d: The most common of licenses, All Alcohol Licenses allow for its holders to sell all categories of liquor to their patrons (including distilled spirits like gin, vodka, and rum).
These licenses allow establishments to sell wine and malt drinks such as beer and cider as well as so called cordials which are defined as "distilled spirits [mixed] with or over fruits, flowers, plants [etc.] containing no less than two and one-half percent sugar by weight," while limiting the ability to sell distilled spirits and other "hard" liquor.
database.licenseTerminology.transferable: The majority of Boston’s liquor licenses, they are usable throughout the city and can be transferred between business and ownership, with approval by the City and State.
database.licenseTerminology.nonTransfera: Created by special legislations, including the 2024 law, These licenses are beholden to the limitations of their respective legislation. They are non-transferable, meaning that should a business close or ownership change, they revert back to the City.

home.aboutUs.title: Who We Are:
home.aboutUs.weAre.part1: We are a collection of restaurant owners, bartenders, chefs, and patrons; Just Like You. We understand how hard it is navigating the red tape of liquor licenses in Boston especially as a newcomer.
home.aboutUs.weAre.part2: From tracking availability, understanding the application process, to the potential hidden costs of obtaining one: there is a lot to keep track of. We’ve made it our mission to demystify the process, and help you get your business off the ground as painlessly as possible.
home.caseStudy.part1: Getting a Liquor License in Boston has long meant being part of an "In Club" of restaurant owners, hospitality companies, and lawyers who've mastered the process. It has historically meant newcomers to the space have struggled to obtain these artificially scarce licenses, and has created droughts in neighborhoods all over the city. Our research has shown a direct correlation between how white a neighborhood is and how many liquor licenses it has.
home.caseStudy.part2: Recent changes have made moves to improve access to Licenses. A new law passed in 2024 aims to increase access to liquor licenses, creating licenses for specific ZIP codes. However, this is just the start. Tracking available licenses is still difficult, and access to accurate, up-to-date information is often out of reach.
home.caseStudy.part3: With this site we are working to create a more equitable restaurant ecosystem with readily available, free, and accurate information for all and enabling restaurant operators to track and understand what Licenses are available to them.
home.caseStudy.title: Why is this important?
home.caseStudy.video.title: License to Succeed - Liquor License Informational Video

home.hero.heading: Boston’s Liquor License system can be confusing. We’re here to help you navigate it and ensure your business can succeed.
home.hero.title: Upscale bar with old-school industrial bulbs as a decoration
home.quote: ...working to create a more equitable restaurant ecosystem for all...
